verses.text: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle \add at\add* Edrei.

And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Fear him not: for I will deliver him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou shalt do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
So the \sc Lord\sc* our God delivered into our hands Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none was left to him remaining.
And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
All these cities \add were\add* fenced \add with\add* high walls, gates, and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many.
And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.
But all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves.
And we took at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites the land that \add was\add* on \add this\add* side Jordan, from the river of Arnon unto mount Hermon;
(\add which\add* Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion; and the Amorites call it Shenir;)
all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salchah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants; behold, his bedstead \add was\add* a bedstead of iron; \add is\add* it not in Rabbath of the children of Ammon? nine cubits \add was\add* the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.

And this land, \add which\add* we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which \add is\add* by the river Arnon, and half mount Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, \add being\add* the kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.
Jair the son of Manasseh took all the country of Argob unto the coasts of Geshuri and Maachathi; and called them after his own name, Bashan-havoth-jair, unto this day.
And I gave Gilead unto Machir.

And unto the Reubenites and unto the Gadites I gave from Gilead even unto the river Arnon, half the valley, and the border, even unto the river Jabbok, \add which is\add* the border of the children of Ammon;
the plain also, and Jordan, and the coast \add thereof\add*, from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, \add even\add* the salt sea, under Ashdoth-pisgah eastward.

And I commanded you at that time, saying, The \sc Lord\sc* your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all \add that are\add* meet for the war.
But your wives, and your little ones, and your cattle, (\add for\add* I know that ye have much cattle,) shall abide in your cities which I have given you;

until the \sc Lord\sc* have given rest unto your brethren, as well as \add unto\add* you, and \add until\add* they also possess the land which the \sc Lord\sc* your God hath given them beyond Jordan: and \add then\add* shall ye return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.

And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have seen all that the \sc Lord\sc* your God hath done unto these two kings: so shall the \sc Lord\sc* do unto all the kingdoms whither thou passest.
Ye shall not fear them: for the \sc Lord\sc* your God he shall fight for you.
And I besought the \sc Lord\sc* at that time, saying,

O Lord \sc God\sc*, thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God \add is there\add* in heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might?
I pray thee, let me go over, and see the good land that \add is\add* beyond Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.
But the \sc Lord\sc* was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.

Get thee up \add into\add* the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold \add it\add* with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which thou shalt see.
So we abode in the valley over against Beth-peor.
